snippet: The city is not doing enough to curtail the use of excessive force and improve care for mentally ill inmates.
abstract: Editorial warns of challenge facing Joseph Ponte, commissioner of New York City Correction Dept, as he tries to fulfill his promise of curtailing use of excessive force by corrections officers and improving care for mentally ill prisoners; notes scope of use of excessive force is alarming, and problem could be too entrenched for city to handle; maintains Justice Dept will have to step in if rapid improvements cannot be made.
lead_paragraph: The city is not doing enough to curtail the use of excessive force and improve care for mentally ill inmates.

headline.main: Brutality in New York City Jails
